ovdesc.p: This table allows the user to define the parameters governing the rules for the handling of the allocation of PM.POSN.CLASS keys according to the Category code in the Loans and Deposits record.
The position management activities for Loans and Deposits are pre-defined and cannot be changed.
There are a set of fields covering the category code ranges and the PM.POSN.CLASS activities, which are expanded together for each "range".
The category code ranges are split to provide a deposit (Liability) range and a loan (asset) range for each set of PM.POSN.CLASS activities.

desc.p: Specifies the position class used to reflect future interest payments (i.e not the next scheduled payment) for variable interest contracts.

The next interest payment will always be shown as a cash flow movement, if this field is defined, the later interest payaments will be passed with this position class reference. If not defined, the future movements are also reflecteed as cash flow movements.
Optional input First 2 characters must be LD
Where Position Management (PM) is being actively used and the LD module is installed this record controls how the two modules interact.
In cases where it is common to enter long term loans i.e 10 years or more you may wish to set this value to limit the updates sent to PM to a more reasonable period.

For example if you want to enter a 25 year term loan with monthly settlements of Interest and/or Commission you can limit the number of months of info sent to PM. It is unlikely you would use PM information (broken down on a monthly basis) that far in advance, and to avoid the overhead at input time you can set this field to say 60 (representing 60 months).
If you do require this level of information contact Temenos on advice on system settings which may need tuning.
Optional Input
Must be a number between 1 and 999
This field is obsolete at 14.2.0

This field specifies whether the position Management module is to include all interest payments for the life of a contract or for just the current interest period..
If this field is null then only the current interest period movements will be shown.
If this field is VARIABLE then all the interest movements for LD contracts not of interest type 1 will be shown.
If this field is FIXED then all the interest movements for LD contracts of interest type 1 will be shown.
If this field is BOTH then all the interest movements for LD contracts of all interest types will be shown.
Can take any of the following values, FIXED VARIABLE BOTH or null.

Defines whethere interest and commission events are to be projected into the future.

The next interest and commission movement will always be shown in the Position Management system. Subsequent events will not be included unless this field is defined. It may contain the following values:

BOTH - Show fixed and variable rate contract future payments VARIABLE - Show only future payments for variable interest contracts FIXED - Show only future interest and commission payaments for fixed rate contracts.
A fixed rate contract is a contract where INT.RATE.TYPE = 1, all other types are termed variable. Commission may only be fixed rate.

Future interest and commission movements will be shown using the position class defined in POS.FWD.FIX.INT, POS.FWD.VAR.INT or POS.FWD.COMM if defined, otherwaise the movements will be reflected as cash flows in the same way as the first interest or commission payment.

Future interest is calculateed using the current interest rate for all contracts. If a contract is of interest rate type PERIODIC AUTOMATIC, the current rate will be used, unless the field PROJECT.R.TYPE is set to YES in the LMM.INSTALL.CONDS table. In this case the future rate will be projected on R schedule dates using the current setting of the PERIODIC.INTEREST table. This can be recalcualted on the period specified in FWD.R.TYPE.FQU.
Optional input First 2 characters must be LD

Specifies the Position Class to which the user wants to relate the principal repayment gap activity.

The position class for Loans and Deposits can be allocated according to Category Code on the deal. The ranges are contained in fields CATEG.DEP.ST to CATEG.DEP.END and CATEG.LOAN.ST to CATEG.LOAN.END.
